section: 13. Each Member will be responsible for its respective duties as follows: Page 3 of 13 Member Duties Description BorrowMoney.com, inc *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The description of BorrowMoney.com, Inc.'s duties is vague and open to interpretation. The phrase 'HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements' lacks specificity, creating ambiguity about the exact scope of their responsibilities. What specific aspects of the platform are they responsible for? What level of maintenance is required? This vagueness makes it difficult to enforce the clause and determine if BorrowMoney.com, Inc. is fulfilling its obligations. Also there is an inconsistency on the JVLS side. It states they will pay $60,000.00 within 90 days, and it will pay 10% of any revenue from awarded contracts 'In Addition to The Total Contributions'. This implies that the 10% of any revenue is to be added to their capital contribution, but this is never specified.

section: 13. Each Member will be responsible for its respective duties as follows: Page 3 of 13 Member Duties Description BorrowMoney.com, inc *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: There is a misalignment because it is unclear if the duties described for each member are supposed to be their capital contributions. The section is titled 'Member Duties', but the additional amounts to be paid by JVLS, LLC is considered to be 'In Addition to The Total Contributions'.

section: 15. Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: There is a contradiction in the agreed value of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go contribution. The section states that their contribution is '$60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Addition to The Total Contributions'. However, the 'Agreed Value' column assigns a value of $3,500,000.00 USD to this contribution, which is inconsistent with the stated cash and revenue percentage. It is unclear if the 10% is to be added to the total contribution, but this is implied in Section 13.

section: 15. Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: The description of BorrowMoney.com, Inc.'s capital contribution is not well-structured. It mentions '1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty*' which is not clear and appears to include duties within the description of the capital contribution. This makes the text structurally flawed and difficult to understand.

section: 39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
explanation: This clause presents ambiguity in determining the Venture's value. It states the value will be 'based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months'. This is too broad and lacks specific methodology. Revenue can fluctuate, and using only three months might not accurately reflect the true value. Also it's not clear how this revenue translates to a final valuation figure. Does it use a multiple? Are expenses deducted? The lack of clarity creates a significant ambiguity. Additionally, it states that 'A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account'. Given the issues with the Capital Contribution section, it will be difficult to determine the proportion.

section: 39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
explanation: The language 'A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture' is structurally flawed and does not make sense. Given the issues with the Capital Contribution section, it will be difficult to determine the proportion. It also implies that the value of the withdrawal will be based on the respective capital account and is contradictory to the sentence before this one where it talks about 'the total revenue generated over the last 3 months'.
